fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data

Interface ISource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAttachable, ICellStructure, IFetchable, IListStructure, ISecure, ITranslated

    public interface ISource
extends IFetchable, ISecure, ITranslated
    A data source provided by a connector. In terms of an OpenAGE application model, a data source is equivalent to a transaction (multiple transactions may use the same underlying data source, such as an SQL table).

    Descending sources can provide multiple items for each item from this source (OpenAGE concept of "next transaction", from "one to n").

    Ascending sources can provide items shared by multiple items from this source (OpenAGE concept of "mosaic attachment", from "n to one").

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IConnector.getSource(java.util.UUID), IListView

    • Method Detail

      • getSourceName

        String getSourceName()
        Gets the technical (locale-independent) name for this data source. This is defined by the connector.
        Returns:
        the source name.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getSourceConnector

        IConnector getSourceConnector()
        Gets the connector that provides this data source.
        Returns:
        the source connector.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isAuxiliary

        boolean isAuxiliary()
        Indicates if this is an auxiliary source. Auxiliary sources should be accessed by following relationships from non-auxiliary sources.

        Note that this indication is only a hint and not an absolute requirement. Auxiliary sources are normally not accessible from an application's initial navigation entry point (such as a dashboard or a home page) by default.

        Returns:
        true if this is an auxiliary source, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • createItem

        IItem createItem(ITicket usingTicket)
        Creates a new (empty and unsaved) item that can be stored by the record source.
        Parameters:
        usingTicket - authenticates the user performing the request. The returned item will be associated with the user for subsequent operations.
        Returns:
        the new (empty and unsaved) record.
        Throws:
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        Since:
        1.0

      • store

        void store(IItem... items)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Stores a new or existing item using the record source. This can include a heterogenous collection of items, often including items from descending or ascending sources. Where possible, this is an atomic operation (either everything succeeds, or everything fails with no changes made).
        Parameters:
        items - one or more items to store.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the filter or range do not apply to this source.
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when one or more items failed to be stored.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        delete(ITicket, IItem...)

      • delete

        int delete(ITicket usingTicket,
           IItem... items)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Deletes the specified items.
        Parameters:
        usingTicket - authenticates the user performing the request.
        items - items (belonging to this source) to delete.
        Returns:
        the number of items deleted, if known and permanent. Note: "eventually consistent" non-atomic sources may choose not report this, and some other source types may just simply be unaware. When unknown, this therefore returns -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the items do not belong to this source (or if any are null).
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when the operation failed during processing.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        delete(ITicket, ILogicFilter)

      • delete

        int delete(ITicket usingTicket,
           IKey... keys)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Deletes the items matching the specified keys.
        Parameters:
        usingTicket - authenticates the user performing the request.
        keys - keys of items (belonging to this source) to delete.
        Returns:
        the number of items deleted, if known and permanent. Note: "eventually consistent" non-atomic sources may choose not report this, and some other source types may just simply be unaware. When unknown, this therefore returns -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the keys do not apply to this source (or if any are null).
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when the operation failed during processing.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        delete(ITicket, ILogicFilter)

      • delete

        int delete(ITicket usingTicket,
           ILogicFilter filter)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Deletes the items matching the specified logic filter.
        Parameters:
        usingTicket - authenticates the user performing the request.
        filter - boolean filter defining criteria to delete a volume of items in a single operation.
        Returns:
        the number of items deleted, if known and permanent. Note: "eventually consistent" non-atomic sources may choose not report this, and some other source types may just simply be unaware. When unknown, this therefore returns -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the filter does not apply to this source.
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when the operation failed during processing.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        delete(ITicket, IKey...), delete(ITicket, IItem...)

      • getAscendingSources

        List<ISource> getAscendingSources()
        Gets record sources that are related to this record source. In a "1:n" relationship (1 instance of the related record source can match to n instances of this record source), the "n" record sources are referred to as "ascending" or "parent" record sources.

        In terms of OpenAGE data modelling, this corresponds to the concept of the "mosaic attachment". When this is defined, it will be the first item in the returned list.

        For relational databases, this should also include the concept of imported keys (foreign key references in the source's table that refer to primary keys in other tables), listing the sources referred to by the imported keys.

        Returns:
        a non-null (but possibly empty) list of ascending record sources, with no duplicate references.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDescendingSources

        List<ISource> getDescendingSources()
        Gets record sources that are related to this record source. In a "1:n" relationship (1 instance of this record source can match to n instances of the related record source), the "n" record sources are referred to as "descending" or "child" record sources.

        In terms of OpenAGE data modelling, this corresponds to the concept of the "next view". When this is defined, it will be the first item in the returned list.

        For relational databases, this should also include the concept of exported keys (other tables that use foreign key references to refer to the primary key in the source's table), listing the sources referred to by the exported keys.

        Returns:
        a non-null (but possibly empty) list of descending record sources, with no duplicate references.
        Since:
        1.0
